title: Immunizations and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay \(ELISA) for antibody isotype determination

content.content:
Keyhole limpet hemocyanin \(KLH) and DNP-KLH \(Calbiochem-Novabiochem)


Alum \(Serva)


Sterile 1 ml syringes and 30 gage needles


96-well MaxiSorp™ ELISA plates \(Nunc)


DNP-ovalbumin \(Sigma)


PBS + 0.05% Tween 20 \(Sigma)


PBS + 2.5% bovine serum albumin \(Sigma)


Alkaline phosphatase-labeled mouse anti-IgM and subclass IgG-specific antibodies \(Southern Biotech Associates)


Alkaline phosphatase substrate solution \(freshly made; Bio-Rad)

**Immunizations of mice**


**1** Perform precipitation of keyhole limpet hemocyanin \(KLH) or DNP-KLH in alum as described \(2). 


**2** Inject 100 µg of KLH or DNP-KLH precipitated in alum in a total volume of 300 µl \(volume adjusted with PBS) into the peritoneal cavity. Collect serum at d 0, d 7, and d 14 and make serial dilutions in PBS.





**ELISA for antibody isotype determination**


**3** Coat 96-well MaxiSorp
TM
ELISA plates with 50 µl/well of DNP-ovalbumin \(5 µg/ml in PBS), incubate overnight at 4 ˚C \(3).


**4** Wash with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20, block for 3 h with PBS + 2.5% bovine serum albumin. Wash 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20. 


**5** Add diluted serum in triplicates, incubate overnight at 4 ˚C. Wash 3x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20. 


**6** Add alkaline phospatase-labeled mouse IgM- and subclass IgG-specific antibodies \(working dilutions 1:250 – 1:500 in PBS + 2.5% bovine serum albumin). Incubate at 25 ˚C for 1 h. Wash 5x with PBS + 0.05% Tween 20. 


**7** Add 100 µl per well of alkaline phosphatase substrate solution. Read optical density of each well at 405 nm at 10 min and 20 min after substrate addition.

1. Anzelon, A. N., Wu, H. & Rickert, R. C. Pten inactivation alters peripheral B lymphocyte fate and reconstitutes CD19 function. _Nat Immunol_ **4**, 287-294 \(2003).
  2. Sanchez, Y. _et al._ Humoral and cellular immunity to hepatitis B virus-derived antigens: comparative activity of Freund complete adjuvant alum, and liposomes. _Infect Immun_ **30**, 728-733 \(1980).
  3. Engel, P. _et al._ Abnormal B lymphocyte development, activation, and differentiation in mice that lack or overexpress the CD19 signal transduction molecule. _Immunity_ **3**, 39-50 \(1995).
  4. Gallagher, E. D., Xu, S., Moomaw, C., Slaughter, C. A. & Cobb, M. H. Binding of JNK/SAPK to MEKK1 is regulated by phosphorylation. _J Biol Chem_ **277**, 45785-45792 \(2002).
  5. Gallagher, E. D., Gutowski, S., Sternweis, P. C. & Cobb, M. H. RhoA binds to the amino terminus of MEKK1 and regulates its kinase activity. _J Biol Chem_ **279**, 1872-1877 \(2004).
  6. Rush, J. S., Hasbold, J. & Hodgkin, P. D. Cross-linking surface Ig delays CD40 ligand- and IL-4-induced B cell Ig class switching and reveals evidence for independent regulation of B cell proliferation and differentiation. _J Immunol_ **168**, 2676-2682 \(2002).
